questions.question: When is the hackathon?
questions.answer: The hackathon is on 8th and 9th November 2024.

questions.question: What is the theme of the hackathon?
questions.answer: The theme is AI for Good and Sustainable Development.

questions.question: What are the tracks in the hackathon?
questions.answer: The tracks are AI in Agriculture, AI in Healthcare, and AI in Environment Sustainability.

questions.question: Can you list all the sub-areas in the AI in Agriculture track?
questions.answer: AI in Agriculture includes Precision Farming, Smart Irrigation Systems, Market Price Prediction, Crop Monitoring and Management, and Soil Health Monitoring.

questions.question: Can you list all the sub-areas in the AI in Healthcare track?
questions.answer: AI in Healthcare includes Early Detection of Chronic Diseases, Personalized Treatment Plans, Remote Health Monitoring and Alerts, Virtual Health Assistants, AI for Mental Health Support, and AI in Health Insurance Claims Processing.

questions.question: Can you list all the sub-areas in the AI in Environment Sustainability track?
questions.answer: AI in Environment Sustainability includes Air Quality Monitoring and Prediction, Water Quality Monitoring, Biodiversity Monitoring and Conservation, Climate Change Impact Analysis, and Urban Green Space Management.

questions.question: Who is eligible to participate?
questions.answer: The hackathon is open to students of the School of Computing & IT at REVA University.

questions.question: How do I form a team?
questions.answer: Teams of 3-4 members must be formed before or during the registration process.

questions.question: Is registration compulsory?
questions.answer: Yes, registration is compulsory for every team to participate in the Hackathon.

questions.question: Is there a registration fee?
questions.answer: Yes, a nominal registration fee will be informed.

questions.question: When is the registration deadline?
questions.answer: The registration deadline will be informed later.

questions.question: What happens after registration?
questions.answer: Participants will receive a confirmation email upon successful registration.

questions.question: What is the code of conduct?
questions.answer: Participants must adhere to a code of conduct that promotes respect, collaboration, and inclusivity.

questions.question: What are the project requirements?
questions.answer: Projects must be original and developed during the hackathon. Teams may use open-source libraries, frameworks, and APIs but must disclose them during project submission.

questions.question: What are the judging criteria?
questions.answer: Projects will be evaluated based on innovation, technical complexity, usability, and impact.

questions.question: What happens if a team breaks the rules?
questions.answer: Teams may be disqualified for violating rules, engaging in unethical practices, or failing to comply with organizer instructions.

questions.question: What are the presentation requirements?
questions.answer: Teams must prepare a demo or presentation of their project for judging. Presentation time limits and guidelines will be communicated in advance.

questions.question: Will there be prizes?
questions.answer: Yes, prizes and awards will be informed later.

questions.question: What is the schedule of the event?
questions.answer: The event schedule will be shared later.

questions.question: How can I give feedback after the event?
questions.answer: Feedback will be collected after the event to improve future hackathons.

questions.question: How many people are allowed in each team?
questions.answer: Teams should consist of 3 to 4 members.

questions.question: Can we use open-source tools or libraries?
questions.answer: Yes, teams may use open-source libraries, frameworks, and APIs but must disclose them during project submission.

questions.question: Can we work on an existing project?
questions.answer: No, projects must be original and developed during the hackathon.

questions.question: What are the rules for team composition?
questions.answer: Teams must be composed of students from the School of Computing & IT at REVA University. Teams of 3-4 members are required.

questions.question: Will there be any mentorship or guidance provided?
questions.answer: Yes, mentors will be available during the hackathon to guide teams.

questions.question: Do we need to submit the project code?
questions.answer: Yes, teams must submit their project code along with any required documentation during the project submission.

questions.question: How will the judging process work?
questions.answer: Judges will evaluate the projects based on innovation, technical complexity, usability, and the overall impact of the project.

questions.question: Will there be breaks during the hackathon?
questions.answer: Yes, the event schedule, including breaks, will be shared with participants.

questions.question: What if a team member drops out?
questions.answer: If a team member drops out, the remaining team can still continue the project as long as the minimum team size is maintained.

questions.question: Will food and beverages be provided?
questions.answer: Yes, food and beverages will be provided during the event.

questions.question: Do we need to bring our own laptops?
questions.answer: Yes, participants are expected to bring their own laptops and any other required equipment.

questions.question: What happens if our project isn't finished by the deadline?
questions.answer: Teams are encouraged to submit their projects even if they are not completely finished, as long as the core functionality is demonstrated.
